explainability.path_to_improvement: Document how explanations are provided to users affected by AI decisions.

external_accountability.path_to_improvement: Obtain external validation of AI practices or require vendor certifications.

fairness.path_to_improvement: Document bias testing procedures or vendor AI fairness requirements.

governance.findings: PBF Energy's documentation and third-party sources describe the company's intent for responsible AI integration, including into occupational health, and their philosophy of viewing AI as an integrated component for strategic implementation. These sources detail the company's strategic decision-making process for AI, including studying peer usage and shaping their digital and AI strategy. They also reference lessons learned from early AI missteps, the need for a cultural shift, and a focus on accountability and learning regarding AI's success and failure.
governance.path_to_improvement: Name an AI governance body with defined mandate covering all AI use.

relevant_sources.summary: This section of the PBF Energy 2024 Sustainability Report provides evidence for the **governance** and **transparency** pillars of responsible AI. The report supports governance by mentioning the company's intent for "responsible integration" of AI into occupational health. Transparency is supported by the mention of AI "capabilities" and the company's exploration of these technologies, indicating an awareness of what AI can do.
relevant_sources.title: PBF Energy 2024 Sustainability Report – reference to AI in occupational health

relevant_sources.summary: This vendor case study provides evidence for the **governance** and **transparency** pillars of responsible AI. For governance, it describes PBF Energy's philosophy of viewing AI as an "integrated component" to "enhance and support" operations and their "strategic implementation" of AI. Regarding transparency, the blog post details how ClearDox's AI/ML/NLP platform functions as a "seamless part of the business process" and highlights PBF's plans to extend these capabilities into additional business processes, demonstrating a forward-looking approach to AI deployment.
relevant_sources.title: ClearDox case study on PBF Energy’s AI-based intelligent document processing

relevant_sources.summary: This conference session description provides evidence for **governance** and **transparency**. It supports transparency by detailing the deployment of AI tools and their capabilities, including generative AI agents for reporting and data interaction, and by highlighting lessons learned from strategic rollout. The mention of "lessons learned from early missteps" and the need for a "cultural shift" also suggests considerations for AI governance in the context of refinery operations.
relevant_sources.title: AI in Energy Summit session on PBF Energy’s deployment of Seeq Analytics and AI Platform

relevant_sources.summary: This blog post, an interview with PBF Energy's Director of Maintenance & Reliability, provides evidence for **governance** and **transparency**. The discussion of AI's role in improving asset reliability and data-driven decision-making, along with the mention of understanding AI's success and failure, suggests a focus on accountability and learning, aligning with governance. Furthermore, the description of AI's capabilities, such as forecasting and optimization, supports transparency by detailing how the technology is being utilized.
relevant_sources.title: Interview with PBF Energy’s Director of Maintenance & Reliability on expanding AI and advanced analytics

relevant_sources.summary: This industry blog post provides evidence for **governance** and **transparency**. It supports governance by detailing PBF Energy's strategic decision-making process, including studying peer AI usage and shaping their digital and AI strategy. The post also supports transparency by describing the company's exploration of AI capabilities and their efforts to understand and apply AI to their refinery sensor data.
relevant_sources.title: Profile of PBF Energy’s early exploration of AI for refinery sensor data and optimization

oversight.path_to_improvement: Document human review processes for AI-assisted decisions (built or vendor AI).

privacy.path_to_improvement: Document data protection practices for AI systems, including vendor AI data handling.

transparency.findings: PBF Energy's documentation and third-party sources describe the company's exploration of AI technologies and their capabilities, including forecasting, optimization, and generative AI agents for reporting and data interaction. These sources detail how AI platforms function as a seamless part of business processes and highlight plans to extend these capabilities. They also reference lessons learned from strategic AI rollout and efforts to understand and apply AI to refinery sensor data.
transparency.path_to_improvement: Publish detailed documentation (model cards, system specs) for AI systems deployed.

summary.overall_findings: Drawing from 5 publicly available sources, PBF Energy's published materials address 2 of 7 evaluated responsible AI pillars, specifically transparency and governance. For transparency, reports reference the company's exploration of AI technologies and mention AI capabilities. Governance materials describe the company's philosophy of viewing AI as an integrated component to enhance and support operations, and mention intent for responsible integration of AI into occupational health. No qualifying public evidence was found for the majority of the 7 evaluated pillars.
